CrossingReality
Class ControlPanel

java.lang.Object
  CrossingReality.MethodServer
      CrossingReality.ControlPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.EventListener
public class ControlPanel
extends MethodServer
implements java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener

This is the central application of the 'Crossing Reality' toolkit for creating cross-reality environments leveraging wireless sensor networks, actuators and virtual worlds. This application combines the GUI, database connectivity and the 2 interfaces, WSN-to-VW and VW-to-Actuators that make up the toolkit. This class extends the MethodServer class, which implements much of the common functionality and required mappings of an XML-RPC server. Arguments to the main method are; [0] - the port that the XML-RPC server runs on (this forms part of the WSN-to-VW interface) [1] - the port that the HTTP server runs on (this forms part of the VW-t0-ACtuator interface) For further information about the design, implementation and usage of this application, please see the accompanying report, in particular Appendix C (User Manual).

Version:
15/04/2011
Author:
060005151

(package private)  class ControlPanel.HTTPHandler
          An implementation of com.sun.net.HttpHandler for handling actuator commands sent from the virtual world to the control panel using HTTP POST.

appendToOutput

private void appendToOutput(java.lang.String toAppend)
Used to add a line of output to the terminal(s) of the GUI, better than sending to System.out as this displays in the GUI. Timestamps are added to the beginning of each line, using the globally defined date format.

Parameters:
toAppend -

setupXMLRPCServer

private void setupXMLRPCServer(int port)
Runs an XML-RPC server on the given port, adds the methods that are wanted to be made available for invocation remotely by RPC to the PropertyHandlerMapping. This XML-RPC server is responsible for receiving reports of sensor readings from the WSN as part of the WSN-to-VW interface.

Parameters:
port -
Throws:
org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
java.io.IOException

setupHTTPServer

private void setupHTTPServer(int port)
Runs an HTTP server on the given port, registers a handler to handle requests coming in. Handling of requests is performed by the HTTPHandler class nested within this class. This HTTP server is responsible for receiving actuator commands from the VW as part of the VW-to-Actuators interface.

Parameters:
port -

sensed

public java.lang.Boolean sensed(java.lang.String id,
                                java.lang.String type,
                                int value)
Allows the wireless sensor network to report a sensor reading to the Control Panel, using the agreed upon protocol. This is the method that is remotely invoked by XMKL-RPC by the WSN when it wishes to report a reading to the virtual world.

Returns:

HTTPPOSTForward

public boolean HTTPPOSTForward(java.lang.String id,
                               java.lang.String type,
                               int value,
                               java.net.URL address)
Forwards a sensor reading to a Virtual World via the defined HTTP POST standard/protocol. Returns true if the POST is delivered successfully (receives a 200 HTTP response code back), false otherwise (eg receives a 400 code back).

Parameters:
id -
type -
value -
address -
Returns:

updateNodeSelect

private void updateNodeSelect(javax.swing.JComboBox list)
Replaces the contents of the given node JComboBox with all of the nodes that are currently registered with the Control panel & are thus in the database.

updateSensorsSelect

private void updateSensorsSelect(javax.swing.JComboBox list,
                                 java.lang.String id)
Replaces the contents of the given sensors JComboBox with all of the sensors that are registered to the node with the given id & are thus in the database.

Parameters:
list -

updateActuatorsSelect

private void updateActuatorsSelect(javax.swing.JComboBox list)
Replaces the contents of the given actuators JComboBox with all of the actuators that are registered with the Control Panel & thus in the database.

Parameters:
list -

manualNodeAdd

private void manualNodeAdd()
Manually add a node (id & address) to the database. Called from the action on a GUI button, uses values in globally accessible text fields as input.

manualSensorAdd

private void manualSensorAdd()
Manually add a sensor (id & type) to the database.

manualActuatorAdd

private void manualActuatorAdd()
Manually add an actuator (id, address & type) to the database.

removeNode

private void removeNode(java.lang.String id)
Removes a node from the database, so that the Control Panel won't 'recognise' it the next time it sends a message. Can also ignore the removed node & not auto add it the next time it sends a message. Checks for any dependent information that must also be removed to maintain database integrity.

Parameters:
id -

removeSensor

private void removeSensor(java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.String type)
Removes the given sensor from the database for the given node, so that the Control Panel won't 'recognise' it the next time it is part of a sensed call. Can also ignore the removed sensor & not auto add it the next time it is part of a sensed call.

Parameters:
id -
type -

removeActuator

private void removeActuator(java.lang.String id)
Removes the given actuator from the database. There is no auto adding feature for actuators, so adding them to an ignore list isn't necessary.

Parameters:
id -

saveMysqlDetails

public void saveMysqlDetails()
Saves the address, username & password of the MySQL server entered by the user for retrieval at a later execution of the program. Saves to a plaintext file, which is insecure, but is more a proof of concept than a final implementation which would store a hash.

Parameters:
address -
user -
pass -

loadMysqlDetails

public void loadMysqlDetails()
Loads the address, username & password of the MySQL server entered by the user previously & saved to file.

SendXMLRPCRequest

private boolean SendXMLRPCRequest(java.lang.String address,
                                  java.lang.String id,
                                  java.lang.String action)
Makes an XML-RPC request to the given address, with the given values. Used to forward an actuator command that came into the Control Panel via HTTP POST from the virtual world, to the appropriate actuator via XML-RPC. Returns true if the XML-RPC request is successful, false otherwise

Returns:
boolean
